intro: Bomarea densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant features thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are often densely covered with hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
